content.raw:
Brilliant, this seems really useful!

We should modify the default config file in the installer to use program files and local app data environment variables as in your example. We’ll also need to add configparser to the dependencies of the installer \(even though we’re close to Python 2 end-of-life\). I think this should work without having to tell the installer to consider different dependencies for Python 2 vs Python 3, since in Python 3 it will just see that the dependency is satisfied via the stdlib.
